articles.title: Thousands got these knee or hip replacements. Then, patients say, parts began to fail.
articles.description: In a torrent of lawsuits, patients accuse Florida device maker Exactech of hiding knee and hip implant defects for years. The company denies the allegations.
articles.content:
Ron Irby expected the artificial knee implanted in his right leg in September 2018 would last two decades — perhaps longer.
Yet in just three years, the Optetrak implant manufactured by Exactech in … [+20730 chars]
